title: Lakshmi Kiran Chandbali: A Symphony of Tradition and Sparkle
materials: Sparkling Cubic Zirconia (CZ) Stones. Features a smooth
Hyderabadi Polish for a rich luster.
features: Intricately crafted Chandbali design featuring floral and paisley motifs. The central crescent moon shape is embellished with pave-set CZ stones, mimicking the brilliance of diamonds. Above the crescent, a stylized floral crest features a vibrant green onyx cabochon. A dangling carnelian cabochon adds a touch of tradition and auspiciousness. The entire piece is finished with delicate gold bead drops, reminiscent of traditional guttapusalu designs.
colors: Dominant gold tone complemented by the vivid green of onyx
and the dazzling white of CZ stones. This classic South Indian color palette exudes regal elegance.
occasions: and traditional ceremonies such as Seemantham or Half-Saree functions (Langa Voni). Also suitable for contemporary evening events where a touch of ethnic elegance is desired.
description: This Chandbali seamlessly blends traditional South Indian design with modern sensibilities. The high-quality 22K gold ensures lasting value and brilliance. The CZ stones provide a diamond-like sparkle at an accessible price point. The craftsmanship reflects the rich heritage of Hyderabad jewelry, making it a valuable heirloom piece. The color combination is considered auspicious in South Indian culture, bringing good fortune to the wearer.
